title: ion-toast
body: A Toast is a subtle notification commonly used in modern applications. It can be used to provide feedback about an operation or to display a system message. The toast appears on top of the app's content, and can be dismissed by the app to resume user interaction with the app.
Toasts can be positioned at the top, bottom or middle of the viewport. The position can be passed upon creation. The possible values are
. If the position is not specified, the toast will be displayed at the bottom of the viewport.
The toast can be dismissed automatically after a specific amount of time by passing the number of milliseconds to display it in the
of the toast options. If a button with a role of
is added, then that button will dismiss the toast. To dismiss the toast after creation, call the

props.name: buttons
props.docs: An array of buttons for the toast.

props.name: color
props.docs: The color to use from your application's color palette. Default options are: "primary", "secondary", "tertiary", "success", "warning", "danger", "light", "medium", and "dark". For more information on colors, see theming.

props.name: cssClass
props.docs: Additional classes to apply for custom CSS. If multiple classes are provided they should be separated by spaces.

props.name: duration
props.docs: How many milliseconds to wait before hiding the toast. By default, it will show until dismiss() is called.

props.name: enterAnimation
props.docs: Animation to use when the toast is presented.

props.name: header
props.docs: Header to be shown in the toast.

props.name: keyboardClose
props.docs: If true, the keyboard will be automatically dismissed when the overlay is presented.

props.name: leaveAnimation
props.docs: Animation to use when the toast is dismissed.

props.name: message
props.docs: Message to be shown in the toast.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: position
props.docs: The position of the toast on the screen.

props.name: translucent
props.docs: If true, the toast will be translucent. Only applies when the mode is "ios" and the device supports backdrop-filter.

methods.name: dismiss
methods.signature: dismiss(data?: any, role?: string | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Dismiss the toast overlay after it has been presented.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: data Any data to emit in the dismiss events.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text:
role The role of the element that is dismissing the toast.
This can be useful in a button handler for determining which button was
clicked to dismiss the toast.
Some examples include: ``"cancel"`, `"destructive"`, "selected"`, and `"backdrop"`.

methods.name: onDidDismiss
methods.docs: Returns a promise that resolves when the toast did dismiss.

methods.name: onWillDismiss
methods.docs: Returns a promise that resolves when the toast will dismiss.

methods.name: present
methods.docs: Present the toast overlay after it has been created.

docs: A Toast is a subtle notification commonly used in modern applications. It can be used to provide feedback about an operation or to display a system message. The toast appears on top of the app's content, and can be dismissed by the app to resume user interaction with the app.

docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.
docsTags.name: virtualProp

events.docs: Emitted after the toast has dismissed.
Emitted after the toast has presented.
Emitted before the toast has dismissed.
Emitted before the toast has presented.

styles.name: --end
styles.docs: Position from the right if direction is left-to-right, and from the left if direction is right-to-left

styles.name: --start
styles.docs: Position from the left if direction is left-to-right, and from the right if direction is right-to-left

styles.name: --white-space
styles.docs: White space of the toast message
